ExerciseForm.howToPlaceholder:
1. Place your feet...
2. Keep your back straight...

Exercises.standard_push_up_desc: Fundamental exercise for mid-chest strength and stability.
Exercises.standard_push_up_howto:
1. Hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep body straight as a plank.
3. Lower until chest nearly touches the floor and push back up.
Exercises.decline_push_up_howto:
1. Feet on an elevated surface (bench).
2. Hands on the floor.
3. Lower with control focusing on the upper chest fibers.
Exercises.incline_push_up_desc: Lighter variation focusing on the lower chest.
Exercises.incline_push_up_howto:
1. Hands on an elevated surface (bench/table).
2. Feet on the floor.
3. Lower your chest toward the support and push back.
Exercises.diamond_push_up_desc: Targets the triceps and the inner chest line.
Exercises.diamond_push_up_howto:
1. Place hands together forming a diamond shape with fingers.
2. Keep elbows close to the ribs.
3. Lower and push focusing on the chest center.
Exercises.wide_push_up_desc: Emphasizes the outer chest and pectoral width.
Exercises.wide_push_up_howto:
1. Position hands well beyond shoulder width.
2. Lower while keeping the chest open.
3. Feel the lateral stretch as you push up.
Exercises.archer_push_up_howto:
1. Arms wide apart.
2. Lower onto one arm while the other stays straight.
3. Alternate sides for each repetition.
Exercises.explosive_push_up_desc: Builds power and recruits fast-twitch fibers.
Exercises.explosive_push_up_howto:
1. Lower normally.
2. Push off the floor with max force so hands leave the ground.
3. Cushion the landing with soft elbows.
Exercises.chest_dips_desc: Powerful strength move for the lower chest contour.
Exercises.chest_dips_howto:
1. Hold the bars and lean your torso forward.
2. Flare elbows out slightly.
3. Lower until you feel a deep stretch and push up.
Exercises.spiderman_push_up_desc: Works chest, core, and hip mobility.
Exercises.spiderman_push_up_howto:
1. While lowering, bring one knee toward the elbow.
2. Keep the body parallel to the floor.
3. Alternate legs with each rep.
Exercises.barbell_bench_press_desc: The gold standard for building chest mass.
Exercises.barbell_bench_press_howto:
1. Lie on the bench and grip the bar wider than shoulders.
2. Lower bar to mid-sternum.
3. Drive the bar up until arms are fully extended.
Exercises.incline_barbell_press_desc: Focuses on filling out the upper chest area.
Exercises.incline_barbell_press_howto:
1. Bench at 30-45 degrees.
2. Lower the bar to the upper chest (near collarbone).
3. Push vertically.
Exercises.decline_barbell_press_desc: Targets the lower portion and allows for maximum weight.
Exercises.decline_barbell_press_howto:
1. Secure feet and lie on the decline bench.
2. Lower bar to the lower chest line.
3. Push with control.
Exercises.close_grip_barbell_press_desc: Emphasizes triceps and inner chest separation.
Exercises.close_grip_barbell_press_howto:
1. Hands shoulder-width or closer.
2. Elbows brushing the ribs on the way down.
3. Focus on squeezing the center at the top.
Exercises.barbell_floor_press_desc: Great for power and shoulder-friendly training.
Exercises.barbell_floor_press_howto:
1. Lie on the floor with knees bent.
2. Lower until triceps lightly touch the ground.
3. Explode up from the dead stop.
Exercises.dumbbell_bench_press_desc: Allows for greater range of motion and symmetry.
Exercises.dumbbell_bench_press_howto:
1. Lie on bench, start with dumbbells high.
2. Lower until dumbbells are at chest level.
3. Drive up and bring them together at the center.
Exercises.incline_dumbbell_press_desc: Essential for upper volume with better range of motion.
Exercises.incline_dumbbell_press_howto:
1. Incline bench setup.
2. Keep dumbbells aligned with upper chest.
3. Push in an arc toward the center.
Exercises.decline_dumbbell_press_desc: Lower chest focus with dumbbell joint comfort.
Exercises.decline_dumbbell_press_howto:
1. Decline bench setup.
2. Control the weight so it stays over the chest.
3. Push focusing on the lower fibers.
Exercises.dumbbell_rotation_press_desc: Increases fiber recruitment via grip change.
Exercises.dumbbell_rotation_press_howto:
1. Start with palms facing forward.
2. Rotate to palms facing you at the top.
3. Squeeze the chest intensely at the peak.
Exercises.squeeze_press_desc: The best for feeling the inner chest contraction.
Exercises.squeeze_press_howto:
1. Press dumbbells together throughout the move.
2. Perform the press without releasing tension between them.
3. Feel constant inner-chest tension.
Exercises.flat_dumbbell_fly_desc: Isolation exercise focused on muscle stretch.
Exercises.flat_dumbbell_fly_howto:
1. Lie flat with slightly bent arms.
2. Open arms wide as if hugging a large tree.
3. Return while squeezing the chest together.
Exercises.incline_dumbbell_fly_desc: Stretch focused on the clavicular portion.
Exercises.incline_dumbbell_fly_howto:
1. Incline bench setup.
2. Open arms laterally with a slight elbow bend.
3. Bring dumbbells together over the face.
Exercises.cable_crossover_high_howto:
1. Pulleys at the top.
2. Pull cables down and forward across the waist.
3. Squeeze the muscles at the bottom.
Exercises.cable_crossover_mid_desc: Works the mid-chest with constant cable tension.
Exercises.cable_crossover_mid_howto:
1. Pulleys at shoulder height.
2. Bring hands together in front of chest.
3. Maintain a stable torso, avoid swinging.
Exercises.cable_crossover_low_desc: Excellent for upper and inner chest shape.
Exercises.cable_crossover_low_howto:
1. Pulleys at the bottom.
2. Bring cables up and forward to chin height.
3. Focus on upper chest contraction.
Exercises.pec_deck_fly_desc: Classic machine for isolation and safe failure.
Exercises.pec_deck_fly_howto:
1. Back flat against the pad.
2. Bring handles together in front of chest.
3. Control the return so plates don't crash.
Exercises.machine_fly_desc: Similar to pec deck but with straight arms for leverage.
Exercises.machine_fly_howto:
1. Adjust the machine arms.
2. Keep elbows slightly bent.
3. Close the arc focusing on the inner contraction.
Exercises.machine_chest_press_desc: Safe way to train with heavy loads to failure.
Exercises.machine_chest_press_howto:
1. Adjust seat so handles are at chest level.
2. Push the handles forward.
3. Control the return maintaining tension.
Exercises.smith_machine_press_desc: Guided bar stability allows focus on muscle squeeze.
Exercises.smith_machine_press_howto:
1. Position bench under the guided bar.
2. Lower with control until near chest.
3. Drive up focusing on mind-muscle connection.
Exercises.landmine_press_desc: Unique angle for upper chest and shoulder health.
Exercises.landmine_press_howto:
1. Barbell in a corner or landmine attachment.
2. Hold the end with one or both hands.
3. Press forward and up in a diagonal line.
Exercises.dumbbell_pullover_howto:
1. Lie across bench (shoulders only supported).
2. Lower dumbbell behind head stretching the torso.
3. Pull back to face level.
Exercises.svendsen_press_desc: Isometric exercise that burns the inner chest.
Exercises.svendsen_press_howto:
1. Squeeze a plate between your palms.
2. Extend arms forward while maintaining pressure.
3. Return to chest without releasing the plate.
Exercises.pull_up_desc: Key exercise for back width and functional strength.
Exercises.pull_up_howto:
1. Grip the bar with palms facing away.
2. Pull your body up until your chin clears the bar.
3. Lower with control until arms are extended.
Exercises.chin_up_desc: Focuses on latissimus dorsi with significant biceps recruitment.
Exercises.chin_up_howto:
1. Grip the bar with palms facing you.
2. Pull your body up, focusing on driving your elbows down.
3. Keep your core tight throughout the move.
Exercises.neutral_grip_pull_up_desc: Safer variation for shoulders, targets the mid-back area.
Exercises.neutral_grip_pull_up_howto:
1. Use parallel handles (palms facing each other).
2. Pull your chest toward your hands.
3. Avoid swinging your body.
Exercises.inverted_row_desc: Great for beginners and posture, performed on bars or rings.
Exercises.inverted_row_howto:
1. Lie under a low bar and grip it with a straight body.
2. Pull your chest up to the bar.
3. Keep your body rigid like a plank.
Exercises.superman_exercise_desc: Isolation exercise to strengthen the lower back and erectors.
Exercises.superman_exercise_howto:
1. Lie face down with arms and legs extended.
2. Lift your chest and thighs off the floor simultaneously.
3. Hold the contraction for 2 seconds and lower.
Exercises.barbell_bent_over_row_desc: The best exercise for back density and thickness.
Exercises.barbell_bent_over_row_howto:
1. Lean your torso forward keeping a straight spine.
2. Pull the bar toward your navel.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades at the top.
Exercises.pendlay_row_desc: Explosive row starting from the floor, focus on power.
Exercises.pendlay_row_howto:
1. Torso parallel to the floor, bar on the ground.
2. Pull the bar explosively to your chest.
3. Return the bar to the floor for each rep.
Exercises.t_bar_row_desc: Classic for hitting the mid-back and traps.
Exercises.t_bar_row_howto:
1. Position the bar between your legs.
2. Hold the handle and keep your chest out.
3. Pull the weight while squeezing your back.
Exercises.one_arm_dumbbell_row_desc: Allows for greater stretch and correction of imbalances.
Exercises.one_arm_dumbbell_row_howto:
1. Support one hand on the bench and the other on the dumbbell.
2. Pull the dumbbell toward your hip (not chest).
3. Feel the stretch on the way down.
Exercises.seal_row_desc: Row performed lying on a high bench, eliminates leg drive.
Exercises.seal_row_howto:
1. Lie face down on an elevated bench.
2. Pull the bar or dumbbells without lifting your chest.
3. Focus entirely on back isolation.
Exercises.renegade_row_desc: Plank and row combination, focuses on core and stability.
Exercises.renegade_row_howto:
1. Push-up position holding two dumbbells on the floor.
2. Row one dumbbell at a time without rotating hips.
3. Keep your core extremely tight.
Exercises.lat_pulldown_wide_grip_desc: Primary exercise for creating back width (V-taper).
Exercises.lat_pulldown_wide_grip_howto:
1. Grip the bar wider than shoulder width.
2. Pull the bar to your upper chest.
3. Avoid leaning too far back.
Exercises.lat_pulldown_close_grip_desc: Focuses on lower lats and mid-back.
Exercises.lat_pulldown_close_grip_howto:
1. Use V-taper handle or close supinated grip.
2. Pull toward your chest focusing on your elbows.
3. Fully extend your arms on the way up.
Exercises.lat_pulldown_behind_neck_desc: Advanced variation to isolate the upper back.
Exercises.lat_pulldown_behind_neck_howto:
1. Pull the bar to the base of your neck.
2. Keep your spine vertical.
3. Requires good shoulder mobility.
Exercises.straight_arm_pulldown_desc: Lat isolation without involving the biceps.
Exercises.straight_arm_pulldown_howto:
1. Arms nearly straight holding the bar high.
2. Push the bar down to your thighs.
3. Control the return feeling the stretch.
Exercises.single_arm_lat_pulldown_howto:
1. Use a single-hand handle.
2. Pull your elbow down and to the side of your body.
3. Slightly rotate your torso for max contraction.
Exercises.seated_cable_row_howto:
1. Feet supported and knees slightly bent.
2. Pull the handle toward your abdomen.
3. Chest out and squeeze your shoulder blades.
Exercises.one_arm_cable_row_desc: Allows for wrist rotation and greater range of motion.
Exercises.one_arm_cable_row_howto:
1. Standing or kneeling in front of the pulley.
2. Pull the cable bringing your elbow behind your body.
3. Alternate arms.
Exercises.face_pull_desc: Essential for shoulder health and mid/lower traps.
Exercises.face_pull_howto:
1. Use the rope on high pulley.
2. Pull the rope toward your face, pulling hands apart.
3. Focus on external shoulder rotation.
Exercises.machine_chest_supported_row_desc: Eliminates lower back fatigue, focusing only on the back.
Exercises.machine_chest_supported_row_howto:
1. Adjust the seat to support your chest well.
2. Grip the handles and pull hard.
3. Control the return without letting the weight drop.
Exercises.deadlift_conventional_desc: The ultimate strength builder for the posterior chain.
Exercises.deadlift_conventional_howto:
1. Bar over mid-foot.
2. Straight back, brace core and stand up.
3. Keep the bar close to your legs.
Exercises.rack_pull_desc: Focuses on the top part of the deadlift and traps.
Exercises.rack_pull_howto:
1. Bar positioned on racks (knee height).
2. Perform the final lockout phase of a deadlift.
3. Use heavier weights than conventional deadlift.
Exercises.back_extension_desc: Safe strengthening for the lower back region.
Exercises.back_extension_howto:
1. Support your hips on the pad.
2. Lower your torso and rise until aligned with legs.
3. Do not hyperextend too far back.
Exercises.good_morning_desc: Posterior chain exercise with the bar on your back.
Exercises.good_morning_howto:
1. Bar on traps, feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hinge at hips keeping your back straight.
3. Feel the hamstring stretch and rise.
Exercises.barbell_shrug_desc: Full focus on the upper trapezius portion.
Exercises.barbell_shrug_howto:
1. Hold the bar in front of your body.
2. Raise your shoulders toward your ears.
3. Hold for 1 second at the top and lower.
Exercises.dumbbell_shrug_desc: More natural grip for traps, allows better focus.
Exercises.dumbbell_shrug_howto:
1. Dumbbells at your sides.
2. Shrug your shoulders vertically.
3. Keep your arms straight at all times.
Exercises.cable_shrug_desc: Constant tension from the start of the movement.
Exercises.cable_shrug_howto:
1. Use a straight bar on the low pulley.
2. Shrug your shoulders against cable resistance.
3. Do not roll shoulders, move only vertically.
Exercises.overhead_barbell_press_desc: The ultimate exercise for raw strength and shoulder mass.
Exercises.overhead_barbell_press_howto:
1. Bar at chest height, hands wider than shoulders.
2. Press the bar overhead until arms are fully extended.
3. Control the descent back to the upper chest.
Exercises.dumbbell_shoulder_press_desc: Allows for greater range of motion and individual stability.
Exercises.dumbbell_shoulder_press_howto:
1. Seated or standing, dumbbells at ear height.
2. Press upward without clanking dumbbells at the top.
3. Lower slowly to a 90-degree angle.
Exercises.arnold_press_desc: Variation that recruits all three deltoid heads.
Exercises.arnold_press_howto:
1. Start with dumbbells in front of face, palms facing you.
2. Rotate hands outward as you press up.
3. Return by rotating palms back toward your face.
Exercises.smith_machine_shoulder_press_desc: Full stability to focus on the muscle and train to failure.
Exercises.smith_machine_shoulder_press_howto:
1. Adjust bench under the guided bar.
2. Press the bar keeping elbows under the load.
3. Control the descent to chin level.
Exercises.seated_military_press_desc: Strict focus on the anterior deltoid without leg assistance.
Exercises.seated_military_press_howto:
1. Sit on a bench with a straight backrest.
2. Pronated grip on the bar.
3. Press vertically while keeping the core tight.
Exercises.dumbbell_lateral_raise_desc: Key exercise for wide shoulders and lateral aesthetics.
Exercises.dumbbell_lateral_raise_howto:
1. Dumbbells at your sides.
2. Raise arms laterally to shoulder height.
3. Lower slowly resisting the weight.
Exercises.cable_lateral_raise_desc: Maintains constant tension throughout the entire movement arc.
Exercises.cable_lateral_raise_howto:
1. Use low pulley positioned to your side.
2. Pull the cable up to shoulder height.
3. Control the return without letting the plates touch.
Exercises.machine_lateral_raise_desc: Ideal mechanical isolation for beginners or burnout sets.
Exercises.machine_lateral_raise_howto:
1. Rest arms against the machine pads.
2. Force elbows upward and outward.
3. Hold for 1 second at the top and return.
Exercises.lean_away_lateral_raise_desc: Increases lateral deltoid stretch at the starting position.
Exercises.lean_away_lateral_raise_howto:
1. Hold a firm support and lean your body outward.
2. Raise the dumbbell or cable laterally.
3. Feel the extra stretch at the bottom.
Exercises.dumbbell_front_raise_desc: Isolates the anterior (front) head of the shoulder.
Exercises.dumbbell_front_raise_howto:
1. Dumbbells in front of thighs.
2. Raise forward to eye level.
3. Alternate arms or perform simultaneously.
Exercises.barbell_front_raise_desc: Works the anterior portion with a fixed, stable load.
Exercises.barbell_front_raise_howto:
1. Grip the bar with a pronated grip.
2. Lift the bar to shoulder height.
3. Keep elbows nearly straight.
Exercises.cable_front_raise_desc: Constant tension to define the front of the shoulder.
Exercises.cable_front_raise_howto:
1. Back to the low pulley, cable between legs.
2. Raise arms in front of your body.
3. Lower while resisting the cable's pull.
Exercises.plate_front_raise_desc: Functional variation that also builds grip strength.
Exercises.plate_front_raise_howto:
1. Hold a plate by the sides (9 and 3 o'clock).
2. Raise to face height.
3. Keep body stable without swinging.
Exercises.rear_delt_dumbbell_fly_desc: Focuses on rear delts and improves posture.
Exercises.rear_delt_dumbbell_fly_howto:
1. Lean torso forward (nearly parallel to floor).
2. Open arms laterally like wings.
3. Squeeze the back of the shoulders.
Exercises.rear_delt_machine_fly_desc: The safest way to isolate the posterior deltoid.
Exercises.rear_delt_machine_fly_howto:
1. Sit facing the machine.
2. Push the handles back keeping arms firm.
3. Focus on shoulder movement, not hands.
Exercises.cable_rear_delt_fly_desc: Excellent for defining the back of the shoulders.
Exercises.cable_rear_delt_fly_howto:
1. Pulleys at high position (cross hands).
2. Pull arms back and out.
3. Control the return, crossing hands again.
Exercises.barbell_upright_row_howto:
1. Bar close to the body.
2. Pull vertically leading with the elbows.
3. Stop at chest height to protect shoulders.
Exercises.dumbbell_upright_row_desc: More comfortable for the wrists than the barbell.
Exercises.dumbbell_upright_row_howto:
1. Dumbbells in front of thighs.
2. Pull toward chin elevating elbows.
3. Keep weights close to the torso.
Exercises.cable_upright_row_desc: Continuous tension for traps and deltoids.
Exercises.cable_upright_row_howto:
1. Use straight bar on low pulley.
2. Pull to chest, keeping elbows above hands.
3. Lower with control.
Exercises.pike_push_up_desc: Calisthenics exercise for shoulder strength at home.
Exercises.pike_push_up_howto:
1. Inverted V-position (hips high).
2. Lower face toward the floor between hands.
3. Push back to starting position.
Exercises.handstand_push_up_howto:
1. Kick up into a handstand against a wall.
2. Lower the top of your head to the floor.
3. Explosively push back up.
Exercises.cable_external_rotation_desc: Strengthens the rotator cuff and prevents injuries.
Exercises.cable_external_rotation_howto:
1. Pulley at elbow height.
2. Rotate forearm outward keeping elbow tucked.
3. Use slow and controlled movements.
Exercises.dumbbell_external_rotation_desc: Basic joint health for any lifter.
Exercises.dumbbell_external_rotation_howto:
1. Lying on side or seated.
2. Rotate dumbbell away from body keeping elbow at 90Â°.
3. Use light weights for cuff focus.
Exercises.barbell_curl_straight_bar_desc: The classic mass builder for the biceps.
Exercises.barbell_curl_straight_bar_howto:
1. Hold the bar with palms up at shoulder width.
2. Keep your elbows tucked to your sides.
3. Curl the bar toward your chest and lower it slowly.
Exercises.ez_bar_curl_desc: Variation that reduces stress on the wrists.
Exercises.ez_bar_curl_howto:
1. Grip the EZ bar on the outer curves.
2. Keep a slight bend in your knees for stability.
3. Lift the bar focusing on biceps contraction and control the descent.
Exercises.barbell_preacher_curl_desc: Total isolation that prevents the use of momentum.
Exercises.barbell_preacher_curl_howto:
1. Rest your arms fully on the preacher bench.
2. Lower the bar to full extension without locking your elbows.
3. Pull the bar back up forcefully, keeping your chest against the pad.
Exercises.drag_curl_desc: Focuses on the long head of the biceps, increasing the arm's peak.
Exercises.drag_curl_howto:
1. Keep the bar tucked against your body at all times.
2. As you lift, drive your elbows back.
3. The bar should 'drag' up your abdomen to the chest line.
Exercises.spider_curl_barbell_desc: Excellent for peak contraction in the front part of the biceps.
Exercises.spider_curl_barbell_howto:
1. Lie face down on a bench inclined at 45 degrees.
2. Let your arms hang vertically.
3. Curl the bar while keeping your elbows stationary and pointing to the floor.
Exercises.dumbbell_alternate_curl_desc: Works each arm individually to correct imbalances.
Exercises.dumbbell_alternate_curl_howto:
1. Hold dumbbells at your sides, palms facing your thighs.
2. Rotate your wrist upward as you lift the weight (supination).
3. Alternate arms in a controlled manner.
Exercises.dumbbell_hammer_curl_desc: Targets the brachialis, providing lateral thickness to the arm.
Exercises.dumbbell_hammer_curl_howto:
1. Hold dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
2. Lift the weight while maintaining this 'hammer' position.
3. Do not rotate your wrists during the movement.
Exercises.incline_dumbbell_curl_desc: Places the biceps in maximum stretch due to the bench angle.
Exercises.incline_dumbbell_curl_howto:
1. Sit on an inclined bench (45-60 degrees).
2. Let your arms hang back behind your torso.
3. Curl the weights while keeping your shoulders back and fixed.
Exercises.concentration_curl_desc: Maximum isolation for detailing and biceps peak.
Exercises.concentration_curl_howto:
1. Seated, rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh.
2. Extend your arm fully and pull toward your shoulder.
3. Avoid using your torso to help the movement.
Exercises.dumbbell_preacher_curl_desc: Allows full focus on each biceps separately on the preacher bench.
Exercises.dumbbell_preacher_curl_howto:
1. Rest one arm on the preacher bench holding the dumbbell.
2. Lower slowly and lift while squeezing the biceps at the top.
3. Use your free hand to stabilize your body.
Exercises.zotterman_curl_desc: Advanced exercise that works both biceps and forearms.
Exercises.zotterman_curl_howto:
1. Curl the weight up with palms facing up.
2. At the top, rotate your wrists 180 degrees (palms down).
3. Lower the weight slowly with the reverse grip.
Exercises.cross_body_hammer_curl_desc: Focuses on the brachialis and brachioradialis with a different angle.
Exercises.cross_body_hammer_curl_howto:
1. With a neutral grip, curl the dumbbell toward the opposite shoulder.
2. The dumbbell should cross in front of your chest.
3. Alternate arms while maintaining control.
Exercises.cable_biceps_curl_straight_bar_desc: Constant tension from the start to the end of the movement.
Exercises.cable_biceps_curl_straight_bar_howto:
1. Use a straight bar on the low pulley.
2. Keep your elbows glued to your ribs.
3. Control the cable's return to keep the weight from crashing.
Exercises.cable_rope_hammer_curl_desc: Continuous tension for the brachialis using the rope.
Exercises.cable_rope_hammer_curl_howto:
1. Hold the rope with a neutral grip.
2. At the top, try to pull the rope ends apart for more contraction.
3. Maintain an upright posture.
Exercises.high_cable_biceps_curl_desc: Simulates the 'double biceps' pose, focusing on the inner peak.
Exercises.high_cable_biceps_curl_howto:
1. Stand in the middle of the crossover with high pulleys.
2. Pull the handles toward your ears.
3. Squeeze your biceps hard at the end and return slowly.
Exercises.bayesian_curl_desc: Cable exercise emphasizing the biceps in a stretched position.
Exercises.bayesian_curl_howto:
1. Facing away from the pulley, hold the handle with your arm extended back.
2. Step forward to create tension.
3. Curl your arm bringing your hand forward, keeping the elbow behind the body.
Exercises.cable_single_arm_curl_desc: Unilateral isolation with the fluidity of cables.
Exercises.cable_single_arm_curl_howto:
1. Facing the low pulley, hold the single-hand handle.
2. Perform the curl focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
3. Keep your shoulder relaxed and elbow fixed.
Exercises.machine_biceps_curl_desc: Ideal for beginners or to safely exhaust the muscle.
Exercises.machine_biceps_curl_howto:
1. Adjust the seat so your elbows align with the machine's axis.
2. Grip the handles and pull steadily.
3. Avoid snapping your arms straight at the bottom.
Exercises.chin_up_biceps_focus_desc: Bodyweight compound exercise with high arm activation.
Exercises.chin_up_biceps_focus_howto:
1. Hang from the bar with palms facing you.
2. Pull your body up focusing on arm strength.
3. Lower slowly and controlled until arms are extended.
Exercises.cable_triceps_pushdown_straight_bar_desc: Basic exercise for strength and lateral triceps definition.
Exercises.cable_triceps_pushdown_straight_bar_howt:
1. Hold the bar with palms facing down.
2. Keep your elbows tucked to your sides.
3. Push the bar down until arms are fully extended and return without moving elbows.
Exercises.cable_triceps_pushdown_v_bar_desc: Provides a more ergonomic and comfortable grip.
Exercises.cable_triceps_pushdown_v_bar_howto:
1. Grip the V-bar firmly.
2. Lean your torso slightly forward.
3. Extend your arms fully and control the return to chest level.
Exercises.cable_rope_pushdown_desc: Allows for greater range of motion and focus on peak contraction.
Exercises.cable_rope_pushdown_howto:
1. Hold the rope and keep elbows fixed.
2. At the bottom of the movement, spread your hands apart.
3. Squeeze triceps for 1 second and slowly return.
Exercises.overhead_cable_extension_rope_desc: Focuses on the long head of the triceps through stretching.
Exercises.overhead_cable_extension_rope_howto:
1. Facing away from the pulley, hold the rope over your head.
2. Flex elbows behind your neck.
3. Extend arms forward and up without flaring your elbows.
Exercises.single_arm_cable_pushdown_howto:
1. Hold the handle with one hand (palm down).
2. Extend the arm fully by your side.
3. Use your other hand to ensure your shoulder doesn't rise.
Exercises.cable_skull_crusher_desc: Constant tension compared to the barbell version.
Exercises.cable_skull_crusher_howto:
1. Lie on the bench facing the low pulley.
2. Hold the bar and bring it toward your forehead.
3. Extend arms vertically while keeping elbows tucked in.
Exercises.barbell_skull_crusher_desc: The classic exercise for gaining triceps mass.
Exercises.barbell_skull_crusher_howto:
1. Lying down, hold the bar above your face.
2. Lower the bar toward your forehead by flexing only the elbows.
3. Push back up without letting your elbows flare out.
Exercises.ez_bar_skull_crusher_desc: Safer for the wrists and elbows.
Exercises.ez_bar_skull_crusher_howto:
1. Hold the EZ-bar on the inner curves.
2. Lower the bar in a controlled manner to your forehead.
3. Extend arms focusing solely on triceps strength.
Exercises.dumbbell_skull_crusher_desc: Works the individual stability of each arm.
Exercises.dumbbell_skull_crusher_howto:
1. Lying down, hold a dumbbell in each hand (palms facing in).
2. Lower the dumbbells beside your ears.
3. Extend arms fully upward.
Exercises.close_grip_barbell_bench_press_desc: Compound exercise allowing heavy loads for triceps.
Exercises.close_grip_barbell_bench_press_howto:
1. Place hands at shoulder width on the bar.
2. Lower the bar to your chest keeping elbows close to your ribs.
3. Push the load up explosively.
Exercises.overhead_dumbbell_extension_seated_desc: Excellent for isolating the long head of the triceps.
Exercises.overhead_dumbbell_extension_seated_howto:
1. Seated, hold one dumbbell with both hands above your head.
2. Lower the weight behind your neck.
3. Extend the arm fully toward the ceiling.
Exercises.overhead_dumbbell_extension_single_arm_d: Increases stretch and focuses on symmetry.
Exercises.overhead_dumbbell_extension_single_arm_h:
1. Hold a dumbbell with one hand above your head.
2. Lower the dumbbell behind the opposite shoulder.
3. Extend the arm while keeping the elbow pointing up.
Exercises.dumbbell_kickback_desc: Total focus on the final triceps contraction.
Exercises.dumbbell_kickback_howto:
1. Lean your torso and keep the elbow high and fixed.
2. Extend the arm back until it is parallel to the floor.
3. Squeeze the triceps and return without swinging.
Exercises.tate_press_desc: Advanced variation for focusing on the lateral head.
Exercises.tate_press_howto:
1. Lying down, hold dumbbells above chest (palms toward feet).
2. Lower dumbbells toward the center of chest, elbows pointing out.
3. Push up using only the triceps.
Exercises.triceps_dips_parallel_bars_desc: Elite exercise for strength and volume.
Exercises.triceps_dips_parallel_bars_howto:
1. Keep your body vertical (do not lean forward).
2. Lower until arms form a 90-degree angle.
3. Push your body up until arms are fully extended.
Exercises.bench_dips_desc: Great variation for beginners or home workouts.
Exercises.bench_dips_howto:
1. Place hands on the bench behind you.
2. With legs extended, lower hips close to the bench.
3. Push back up focusing only on the arms.
Exercises.diamond_push_ups_desc: Push-up variation that prioritizes the triceps.
Exercises.diamond_push_ups_howto:
1. Hands together on the floor forming a diamond with fingers.
2. Lower chest toward your hands.
3. Push the floor away keeping elbows close to your body.
Exercises.machine_triceps_extension_howto:
1. Adjust the seat and rest elbows on the support.
2. Push the handles until arms are straight.
3. Return in a slow and controlled manner.
Exercises.machine_triceps_dip_desc: Simulates parallel dips with greater stability.
Exercises.machine_triceps_dip_howto:
1. Sit and hold the side handles.
2. Push down while keeping chest up.
3. Control the ascent to maintain muscle tension.
Exercises.barbell_wrist_curl_desc: Focuses on the forearm flexors to gain inner volume.
Exercises.barbell_wrist_curl_howto:
1. Rest your forearms on a bench, palms up.
2. Let the bar roll down to your fingers, then close your hand.
3. Flex only your wrists to lift the bar.
Exercises.barbell_reverse_wrist_curl_desc: Develops the upper and outer part of the forearm.
Exercises.barbell_reverse_wrist_curl_howto:
1. Rest your forearms on the bench, palms down.
2. Extend your wrists upward as far as possible.
3. Lower in a controlled manner until you feel the stretch.
Exercises.dumbbell_wrist_curl_desc: Allows for deeper and individualized isolation.
Exercises.dumbbell_wrist_curl_howto:
1. Rest your forearm on your thigh or a bench, palm up.
2. Flex your wrist, bringing the dumbbell toward your forearm.
3. Keep the movement slow and steady.
Exercises.dumbbell_reverse_wrist_curl_desc: Strengthens the extensors and improves wrist stability.
Exercises.dumbbell_reverse_wrist_curl_howto:
1. Rest your forearm with the palm facing down.
2. Lift the dumbbell using only the wrist joint.
3. Control the descent to avoid impact.
Exercises.standing_behind_back_wrist_curl_desc: Standing variation that allows for heavier loads.
Exercises.standing_behind_back_wrist_curl_howto:
1. Standing, hold the bar behind your body with palms facing away.
2. Flex your wrists upward, contracting the forearms.
3. Let the bar lower slightly to your fingertips.
Exercises.dumbbell_radial_deviation_desc: Works the lateral stability of the wrist.
Exercises.dumbbell_radial_deviation_howto:
1. Hold the dumbbell like a hammer at your side.
2. Tilt your wrist upward (toward the thumb).
3. Keep your arm still during execution.
Exercises.dumbbell_ulnar_deviation_desc: Strengthens the outer lateral part of the forearm.
Exercises.dumbbell_ulnar_deviation_howto:
1. Hold the dumbbell like a hammer.
2. Tilt your wrist downward and back (toward the pinky).
3. Return to neutral position and repeat.
Exercises.cable_wrist_curl_desc: Constant tension for an intense muscle pump.
Exercises.cable_wrist_curl_howto:
1. Use a straight bar on the low pulley.
2. With palms up, flex your wrists against the resistance.
3. Do not use your arms to pull the cable.
Exercises.cable_reverse_wrist_curl_desc: Excellent for defining the top of the forearm.
Exercises.cable_reverse_wrist_curl_howto:
1. Use the low pulley with a pronated grip (palms down).
2. Raise your wrists while maintaining cable tension.
3. Control the return to keep the weights from crashing.
Exercises.wrist_roller_desc: One of the most complete exercises for burn and endurance.
Exercises.wrist_roller_howto:
1. Hold the roller with both hands in front of your body.
2. Roll the rope up by rotating the device with your wrists.
3. Unroll in a controlled manner until the end.
Exercises.farmers_walk_desc: Builds an iron grip and functional strength.
Exercises.farmers_walk_howto:
1. Hold heavy dumbbells in each hand.
2. Maintain upright posture and firm shoulders.
3. Walk for a set distance or time.
Exercises.plate_pinch_hold_desc: Total focus on finger and grip strength.
Exercises.plate_pinch_hold_howto:
1. Hold a smooth plate using only your fingertips.
2. Keep the plate suspended at your side.
3. Hold for as long as you can.
Exercises.dead_hang_desc: Improves grip endurance and decompresses the spine.
Exercises.dead_hang_howto:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with a firm grip.
2. Relax your body but keep your hands closed tight.
3. Try to beat your time record with each set.
Exercises.towel_pull_up_hang_howto:
1. Drape a towel over a pull-up bar and grab the ends.
2. Hang holding only the towel.
3. Squeeze your hands hard to prevent slipping.
Exercises.dumbbell_pronation_supination_desc: Works forearm rotation and elbow health.
Exercises.dumbbell_pronation_supination_howto:
1. Hold a dumbbell by one end.
2. Rotate your wrist inward and outward slowly.
3. Keep your elbow bent at 90 degrees and fixed.
Exercises.barbell_back_squat_desc: The king of leg exercises, focuses on total leg volume.
Exercises.barbell_back_squat_howto:
1. Rest the bar on your traps and step your feet out.
2. Lower your hips as if sitting in a chair.
3. Keep your chest up and push through your heels to rise.
Exercises.barbell_front_squat_desc: Higher quad activation and less pressure on the lower back.
Exercises.barbell_front_squat_howto:
1. Hold the bar in front of your body across your shoulders.
2. Keep your elbows high throughout the entire movement.
3. Squat keeping your torso vertical and drive back up.
Exercises.dumbbell_goblet_squat_desc: Excellent for beginners and improving hip mobility.
Exercises.dumbbell_goblet_squat_howto:
1. Hold a dumbbell against your chest with both hands.
2. Squat down between your knees keeping your back straight.
3. Stand up without letting your knees cave in.
Exercises.smith_machine_squat_desc: Assisted stability to focus on muscle failure.
Exercises.smith_machine_squat_howto:
1. Position your feet slightly in front of the bar line.
2. Lower in a controlled manner until thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Push the bar up focusing entirely on your legs.
Exercises.leg_press_45_desc: Allows heavy loads for hypertrophy with high safety.
Exercises.leg_press_45_howto:
1. Place feet on the platform shoulder-width apart.
2. Lower the weight until knees are near your chest.
3. Push back up without locking your knees at the top.
Exercises.hack_squat_machine_desc: Potent isolation for the front part of the thighs.
Exercises.hack_squat_machine_howto:
1. Rest your back against the pad and shoulders under the cushions.
2. Lower until you reach a 90-degree angle.
3. Drive up keeping your heels fixed on the platform.
Exercises.leg_extension_desc: The only exercise that completely isolates the quadriceps.
Exercises.leg_extension_howto:
1. Sit and adjust the roller just above your ankles.
2. Extend your legs fully and squeeze at the top.
3. Return slowly without letting the weights crash.
Exercises.v_squat_machine_desc: Natural movement simulating a squat with added support.
Exercises.v_squat_machine_howto:
1. Step into the machine and unlock the safety handles.
2. Perform a deep squat with control.
3. Drive the platform up using the soles of your feet.
Exercises.bulgarian_split_squat_desc: Elite unilateral exercise for mass gains.
Exercises.bulgarian_split_squat_howto:
1. Rest one foot behind you on a bench and the other forward.
2. Lower your back knee toward the floor.
3. Keep your torso upright and drive up with the front leg.
Exercises.barbell_walking_lunge_howto:
1. With the bar on your traps, take a large step forward.
2. Drop your knee until it almost touches the ground.
3. Step forward continuously with the next leg.
Exercises.dumbbell_walking_lunge_desc: Stable version of the lunge for volume focus.
Exercises.dumbbell_walking_lunge_howto:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step forward and lower your hips vertically.
3. Alternate legs while walking.
Exercises.step_up_desc: Great for functional strength and correcting imbalances.
Exercises.step_up_howto:
1. Place one foot on a box or high bench.
2. Step up using only the strength of the top leg.
3. Lower yourself slowly and with control.
Exercises.sissy_squat_howto:
1. Hold a support and lean your torso back.
2. Project your knees forward as you lower your body.
3. Drive back up by squeezing the front of your thighs.
Exercises.zercher_squat_howto:
1. Hold the bar in the crooks of your elbows against your core.
2. Squat while keeping the bar stable and back straight.
3. Rise while maintaining abdominal pressure.
Exercises.landmine_squat_desc: Angular movement that is comfortable for the joints.
Exercises.landmine_squat_howto:
1. Hold the end of the bar with both hands at chest level.
2. Squat down by projecting your hips slightly back.
3. Drive the bar up following its natural arc.
Exercises.dumbbell_reverse_lunge_desc: Gentler on the knees than the forward lunge.
Exercises.dumbbell_reverse_lunge_howto:
1. From standing, take a step backward instead of forward.
2. Drop your back knee until it nearly touches the floor.
3. Return to starting position by driving through the front leg.
Exercises.barbell_stiff_leg_deadlift_desc: Maximum focus on hamstring stretch and volume.
Exercises.barbell_stiff_leg_deadlift_howto:
1. Keep knees almost straight and the bar close to your legs.
2. Lower your torso by pushing hips back until you feel the stretch.
3. Rise by contracting hamstrings without rounding your back.
Exercises.dumbbell_stiff_leg_deadlift_desc: Allows for a more natural grip adjustment and greater range.
Exercises.dumbbell_stiff_leg_deadlift_howto:
1. Hold dumbbells in front of your thighs.
2. Lower the weights toward your feet while keeping a straight spine.
3. Feel the stretch in the back of your thighs and rise with control.
Exercises.barbell_romanian_deadlift_desc: Core exercise for posterior chain strength.
Exercises.barbell_romanian_deadlift_howto:
1. Start the movement at the hips, slightly bending the knees.
2. Lower the bar until just below the knees.
3. Return to starting position by squeezing glutes and hamstrings.
Exercises.good_morning_barbell_desc: Excellent for strengthening the lower back and hamstrings.
Exercises.good_morning_barbell_howto:
1. Rest the bar on your traps as you would for a squat.
2. Hinge at the hips, leaning forward while keeping legs straight.
3. Return to upright position using thigh strength.
Exercises.lying_leg_curl_machine_desc: Isolates the hamstrings through knee flexion.
Exercises.lying_leg_curl_machine_howto:
1. Lie face down and align knees with the machine's axis.
2. Flex your legs, bringing the roller toward your glutes.
3. Lower the weight in a slow and controlled manner.
Exercises.seated_leg_curl_machine_desc: Provides a more intense muscle contraction.
Exercises.seated_leg_curl_machine_howto:
1. Adjust the thigh pad so you remain secure.
2. Push the roller down to maximum flexion.
3. Control the return to maintain muscle tension.
Exercises.standing_single_leg_curl_machine_desc: Corrects imbalances and focuses on individual isolation.
Exercises.standing_single_leg_curl_machine_howto:
1. Lean against the machine and position the roller on your ankle.
2. Curl your leg back as far as possible.
3. Alternate legs after completing the set.
Exercises.nordic_hamstring_curl_desc: Elite exercise for eccentric strength and injury prevention.
Exercises.nordic_hamstring_curl_howto:
1. Kneel and have someone hold your ankles down.
2. Lower your body forward as slowly as possible.
3. Use your hands to push yourself back up at the bottom.
Exercises.sliding_leg_curl_towel_desc: Great home option using a towel or socks on a smooth floor.
Exercises.sliding_leg_curl_towel_howto:
1. Lying down, place heels on a towel on a smooth surface.
2. Lift your hips and pull your heels toward your body.
3. Extend legs back out without dropping your hips.
Exercises.stability_ball_leg_curl_howto:
1. Rest your heels on top of the ball.
2. Lift your hips and pull the ball toward your body.
3. Keep your core tight and don't let your hips sag.
Exercises.glute_ham_raise_desc: Brutal strength and posterior power development.
Exercises.glute_ham_raise_howto:
1. Position knees on the pad and feet against the support.
2. Lower your torso forward and rise using only your thighs.
3. Keep a neutral spine throughout the entire range.
Exercises.single_leg_romanian_deadlift_dumbbell_de: Improves balance and isolates each leg individually.
Exercises.single_leg_romanian_deadlift_dumbbell_ho:
1. Hold the dumbbell in the hand opposite to the standing leg.
2. Hinge at the hip and lift the back leg for balance.
3. Lower until you feel the stretch and rise firmly.
Exercises.cable_pull_through_desc: Constant tension focused on the hip hinge.
Exercises.cable_pull_through_howto:
1. Facing away from the pulley, hold the rope between your legs.
2. Hinge your hips back and then drive them forward.
3. Squeeze glutes and hamstrings at the top of the movement.
Exercises.dumbbell_leg_curl_lying_desc: Effective leg curl adaptation using only a dumbbell.
Exercises.dumbbell_leg_curl_lying_howto:
1. Lying face down, secure a dumbbell between your feet.
2. Flex your knees, bringing the weight upward.
3. Lower slowly to ensure the dumbbell doesn't slip.
Exercises.kettlebell_swing_desc: Explosive movement for the entire posterior chain.
Exercises.kettlebell_swing_howto:
1. Hold the kettlebell and hinge your hips back.
2. Drive the weight forward using hip power.
3. The movement is a hip hinge, not a squat.
Exercises.barbell_hip_thrust_desc: The best exercise for glute hypertrophy and maximum strength.
Exercises.barbell_hip_thrust_howto:
1. Rest your upper back on a bench with the bar over your hips.
2. Drive your hips up until your body is horizontal.
3. Squeeze your glutes hard at the top and lower with control.
Exercises.dumbbell_hip_thrust_desc: Practical variation for isolation and home workouts.
Exercises.dumbbell_hip_thrust_howto:
1. Position a dumbbell over your pelvis and support your back.
2. Elevate your hips while intensely contracting your glutes.
3. Keep your chin tucked slightly toward your chest.
Exercises.barbell_glute_bridge_desc: Floor-based version focused on constant contraction.
Exercises.barbell_glute_bridge_howto:
1. Lying on the floor, place the bar over your hips.
2. Push through your heels to elevate your pelvis.
3. Lower before your glutes fully touch the floor to maintain tension.
Exercises.machine_hip_thrust_desc: Maximum stability to train until muscle failure.
Exercises.machine_hip_thrust_howto:
1. Adjust the machine's belt or pad over your hips.
2. Drive the platform up explosively by raising your hips.
3. Control the descent feeling the muscle stretch.
Exercises.seated_hip_abduction_machine_desc: Isolates the gluteus medius, essential for the lateral contour.
Exercises.seated_hip_abduction_machine_howto:
1. Sit and press your back firmly against the support.
2. Spread your legs by pushing the pads outward.
3. Hold for a second at maximum width and return slowly.
Exercises.cable_hip_abduction_desc: Works stability and lateral glute with constant tension.
Exercises.cable_hip_abduction_howto:
1. Attach the ankle strap to the low pulley and stand sideways.
2. Raise your leg to the side while keeping your torso fixed.
3. Control the leg's return without swinging your body.
Exercises.banded_clamshells_desc: Key activation for hip health and gluteus medius.
Exercises.banded_clamshells_howto:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and a band above them.
2. Open your top knee while keeping your feet together.
3. Feel the side of your glute burn and close slowly.
Exercises.lateral_band_walk_desc: Dynamic exercise for activating the entire side of the leg.
Exercises.lateral_band_walk_howto:
1. Place the band around your ankles and stand in a half-squat.
2. Take lateral steps while maintaining tension on the band.
3. Do not let your knees collapse inward.
Exercises.cable_glute_kickback_desc: Classic isolation to shape the gluteus maximus.
Exercises.cable_glute_kickback_howto:
1. Facing the pulley, kick your leg back and slightly outward.
2. Contract your glute at the end of the movement.
3. Return your leg without rounding your lower back.
Exercises.machine_glute_kickback_desc: Allows for heavier loads to build glute strength.
Exercises.machine_glute_kickback_howto:
1. Position your foot on the machine's platform.
2. Push backward until full hip extension.
3. Keep your core tight to protect your spine.
Exercises.quadruped_hip_extension_donkey_kicks_des: Excellent for home workouts and muscle activation.
Exercises.quadruped_hip_extension_donkey_kicks_how:
1. In a quadruped position, drive your heel toward the ceiling.
2. Keep your knee bent at 90 degrees.
3. Squeeze your glute at the top without arching your back.
Exercises.fire_hydrants_desc: Focuses on the gluteus medius and external hip rotation.
Exercises.fire_hydrants_howto:
1. On all fours, lift your knee to the side like a dog.
2. Keep your hips level throughout the movement.
3. Return to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Exercises.barbell_sumo_deadlift_desc: Deadlift variation that targets glutes and adductors more.
Exercises.barbell_sumo_deadlift_howto:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, toes out.
2. Grip the bar with arms inside your legs.
3. Drive through the floor and finish by squeezing your glutes.
Exercises.dumbbell_sumo_squat_desc: Works glutes and inner thighs simultaneously.
Exercises.dumbbell_sumo_squat_howto:
1. Hold a heavy dumbbell between your legs with a wide stance.
2. Squat deeply while keeping your torso upright.
3. Rise by focusing on glute strength.
Exercises.cable_glute_medially_rotated_kickback_de: Advanced variation to target upper glute fibers.
Exercises.cable_glute_medially_rotated_kickback_ho:
1. At the cable, rotate your toe slightly inward.
2. Kick back and out at a diagonal.
3. Focus on contracting the upper part of the glute.
Exercises.frog_pumps_desc: High-repetition exercise to generate an intense muscle pump.
Exercises.frog_pumps_howto:
1. Lying down, bring the soles of your feet together (butterfly position).
2. Lift your hips while keeping your knees open.
3. Perform short, fast movements focusing on the burn.
Exercises.curtsy_lunge_desc: Lunge variation that emphasizes the side of the glute.
Exercises.curtsy_lunge_howto:
1. Take a step back, crossing one leg behind the other.
2. Lower your knee toward the floor.
3. Return to the starting position and alternate sides.
Exercises.hyperextension_45_degree_glute_focus_des: Uses hip extension to work glutes and hamstrings.
Exercises.hyperextension_45_degree_glute_focus_how:
1. Adjust the pad below your hip line.
2. Slightly round your upper back and turn your feet out.
3. Rise using only glute strength.
Exercises.standing_barbell_calf_raise_desc: Raw strength exercise for total calf volume.
Exercises.standing_barbell_calf_raise_howto:
1. With the bar on your traps, position the balls of your feet on a block.
2. Lower your heels as far as possible to stretch the muscle.
3. Explosively rise onto your toes and squeeze at the top.
Exercises.standing_machine_calf_raise_desc: Secure isolation that allows for heavy loads and control.
Exercises.standing_machine_calf_raise_howto:
1. Position shoulders under the pads and feet on the platform.
2. Perform the full range of motion by moving your ankles up and down.
3. Keep knees extended (not locked) to focus on the gastrocnemius.
Exercises.dumbbell_single_leg_calf_raise_desc: Excellent for correcting asymmetries between legs.
Exercises.dumbbell_single_leg_calf_raise_howto:
1. Hold a dumbbell in one hand and use the other for balance.
2. Stand on one foot on the edge of a step.
3. Raise and lower slowly, focusing on balance and contraction.
Exercises.smith_machine_calf_raise_desc: Smith machine stability to focus purely on the muscle burn.
Exercises.smith_machine_calf_raise_howto:
1. Place a step or block under the Smith bar.
2. Rest the bar on your shoulders and the balls of your feet on the step.
3. Execute the plantar flexion with maximum range of motion.
Exercises.seated_machine_calf_raise_desc: Total focus on the soleus muscle, which gives calves width.
Exercises.seated_machine_calf_raise_howto:
1. Adjust the knee pad and sit with a straight back.
2. Lift your heels to unlock the weight safety.
3. Lower as far as you can and rise with a strong contraction.
Exercises.seated_dumbbell_calf_raise_howto:
1. Sit down and rest one or two dumbbells on your knees.
2. Place the balls of your feet on an elevated support.
3. Perform the up and down movement in a controlled manner.
Exercises.seated_barbell_calf_raise_desc: Heavy alternative for soleus training without a machine.
Exercises.seated_barbell_calf_raise_howto:
1. Sit on a bench and place a padded barbell across your thighs.
2. Use a step to increase the range of motion for your feet.
3. Lift the weight using only ankle strength.
Exercises.leg_press_calf_press_desc: Great for maintaining constant tension and using heavy weights.
Exercises.leg_press_calf_press_howto:
1. Position only the balls of your feet on the bottom edge of the platform.
2. Push the platform by extending your ankles.
3. Allow the weight to return, stretching the calves thoroughly.
Exercises.donkey_calf_raise_desc: Old-school exercise providing extreme muscle stretch.
Exercises.donkey_calf_raise_howto:
1. Hinge forward at the hips and support your arms.
2. If using a machine, the weight sits on the hips. If free, a partner sits on your back.
3. Execute the raise focusing on the bottom stretch.
Exercises.hack_squat_calf_press_desc: Inclined position favoring strength and isolation.
Exercises.hack_squat_calf_press_howto:
1. Stand in the Hack machine and place feet on the edge of the platform.
2. Push the weight up using the balls of your feet.
3. Keep knees straight throughout the entire set.
Exercises.bodyweight_standing_calf_raise_desc: Basic and efficient for beginners or warm-ups.
Exercises.bodyweight_standing_calf_raise_howto:
1. Stand with feet on the floor or a step.
2. Rise as high as possible onto your toes.
3. Lower slowly. Can be done bilaterally or unilaterally.
Exercises.stair_calf_raise_desc: Best bodyweight variation for gaining extra range of motion.
Exercises.stair_calf_raise_howto:
1. Stand on the edge of a stair step.
2. Allow your heels to drop below the step level.
3. Rise as high as possible, holding for one second at the top.
Exercises.tibialis_raise_desc: Strengthens the front of the shin, preventing injuries.
Exercises.tibialis_raise_howto:
1. Lean your back against a wall and extend your legs forward.
2. Lift only the toes toward your shins.
3. Lower slowly and feel the front of the leg working.
Exercises.farmer_walk_on_toes_desc: Works muscular endurance and ankle stability.
Exercises.farmer_walk_on_toes_howto:
1. Hold a pair of heavy dumbbells at your sides.
2. Stand on your toes and walk while keeping heels high.
3. Do not let your heels touch the floor during the walk.
Exercises.seated_adduction_machine_desc: The most effective isolation exercise for the inner thighs.
Exercises.seated_adduction_machine_howto:
1. Sit in the machine with legs spread and knees against the pads.
2. Close your legs in a controlled manner until the pads touch.
3. Return to the starting position feeling the stretch in your adductors.
Exercises.cable_hip_adduction_desc: Works the inner thigh unilaterally with constant tension.
Exercises.cable_hip_adduction_howto:
1. Attach an ankle strap to the low pulley and stand sideways to the machine.
2. Pull your leg toward the center of your body, crossing slightly in front of your standing leg.
3. Control the return without letting the weights crash.
Exercises.standing_adduction_machine_desc: Unilateral variation that requires core stability.
Exercises.standing_adduction_machine_howto:
1. Position your leg against the pad of the multi-hip machine.
2. Push the pad inward toward your supporting leg.
3. Keep your torso upright throughout the entire movement.
Exercises.barbell_sumo_squat_adductor_focus_desc: A wide-stance squat variation that places maximum emphasis on the inner thighs.
Exercises.barbell_sumo_squat_adductor_focus_howto:
1. Position the barbell on your back and place your feet wider than shoulder-width, toes pointed out.
2. Squat down while keeping your knees aligned with your toes.
3. Lower until your thighs are parallel to the floor and rise while focusing on the contraction of the adductors.
Exercises.barbell_sumo_deadlift_adductor_focus_des: Heavy variation that strongly recruits adductors due to the wide stance.
Exercises.barbell_sumo_deadlift_adductor_focus_how:
1. Set your feet significantly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Squat to grip the bar while keeping knees aligned with your feet.
3. Drive upward by pushing through the floor, focusing on inner leg strength.
Exercises.side_lunge_desc: Develops lateral strength and dynamic adductor stretching.
Exercises.side_lunge_howto:
1. Take a wide step to the side, bending one knee while keeping the other leg straight.
2. Push off the floor to return to the starting position.
3. Keep your feet pointed forward.
Exercises.copenhagen_plank_desc: Elite exercise for functional strength and groin injury prevention.
Exercises.copenhagen_plank_howto:
1. Lying on your side, place your top leg on a bench and your elbow on the floor.
2. Lift your hips and try to keep your bottom leg off the ground.
3. Hold the position while keeping your body perfectly aligned.
Exercises.lying_leg_adduction_side_lying_desc: Simple and effective isolation, ideal for home workouts.
Exercises.lying_leg_adduction_side_lying_howto:
1. Lie on your side and cross your top leg in front of your body.
2. Lift your bottom leg (the straight one) toward the ceiling.
3. Lower without touching the floor and repeat.
Exercises.seated_band_adduction_desc: Elastic resistance variation for muscle activation.
Exercises.seated_band_adduction_howto:
1. While seated, attach a band to a fixed lateral point and your ankle.
2. Pull your leg inward against the band's resistance.
3. Slowly control the return of the leg.
Exercises.ball_squeeze_bridge_desc: Combines a glute bridge with isometric adductor activation.
Exercises.ball_squeeze_bridge_howto:
1. Lying on your back, place a pilates ball between your knees.
2. Lift your hips while squeezing the ball with constant force.
3. Maintain the squeeze throughout the entire movement.
Exercises.seated_abduction_machine_desc: Classic isolation for the gluteus medius and lateral hip contour.
Exercises.seated_abduction_machine_howto:
1. Sit in the machine with your back firmly against the support.
2. Push the pads outward using the sides of your knees/thighs.
3. Control the return without letting the weight plates crash.
Exercises.cable_standing_hip_abduction_desc: Works hip stability and the lateral glute unilaterally.
Exercises.cable_standing_hip_abduction_howto:
1. Attach an ankle strap to the low pulley and hold the machine for balance.
2. Raise your leg to the side as far as possible without tilting your torso.
3. Return slowly while maintaining tension on the cable.
Exercises.cable_lying_hip_abduction_desc: Variation offering a deep initial stretch and constant tension.
Exercises.cable_lying_hip_abduction_howto:
1. Lie on the floor sideways to the low pulley with the strap on the top leg.
2. Lift your leg toward the ceiling.
3. Control the descent, feeling the muscle stretch.
Exercises.side_lying_leg_raise_desc: Simple isolation exercise, excellent for home workouts.
Exercises.side_lying_leg_raise_howto:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight.
2. Lift your top leg while keeping your foot pointed forward.
3. Lower slowly without relaxing the muscles between reps.
Exercises.clamshells_desc: Fundamental for gluteus medius activation and knee health.
Exercises.clamshells_howto:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and heels together.
2. Open your top knee like a clam, without rotating your hips backward.
3. Feel the contraction on the side of the glute and close slowly.
Exercises.banded_lateral_walk_desc: Dynamic activation essential for pelvic stability.
Exercises.banded_lateral_walk_howto:
1. Place a resistance band around your ankles or above your knees.
2. In a half-squat position, take lateral steps while maintaining tension.
3. Keep your knees aligned with your feet, don't let them cave in.
Exercises.banded_monster_walk_desc: Strengthens abductors and glutes in a diagonal movement.
Exercises.banded_monster_walk_howto:
1. With the band on your legs, set feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Walk forward in diagonal steps (like a monster).
3. Always maintain tension on the band during the movement.
Exercises.banded_seated_abduction_desc: High-repetition variation to generate a pump and muscle exhaustion.
Exercises.banded_seated_abduction_howto:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench with the band above your knees.
2. Spread your knees as far as possible against the resistance.
3. Hold for a second at maximum width and close slowly.
Exercises.curtsy_lunge_bodyweight_desc: Dynamic variation that challenges lateral stabilization.
Exercises.curtsy_lunge_bodyweight_howto:
1. Step back, crossing one leg behind the standing leg.
2. Lower your knee toward the floor.
3. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
Exercises.side_plank_with_leg_lift_desc: Advanced exercise combining core strength and abductor work.
Exercises.side_plank_with_leg_lift_howto:
1. In a side plank position, support your body weight.
2. Lift your top leg while keeping it straight.
3. Keep your hips high and do not let your body rotate.
Exercises.plank_desc: Fundamental isometric exercise for core endurance and stability.
Exercises.plank_howto:
1. Support yourself on your forearms and toes.
2. Keep your body in a straight line, without letting your hips sag or rise.
3. Tighten your abs and glutes throughout the duration.
Exercises.side_plank_desc: Focuses on the obliques and lateral spinal stability.
Exercises.side_plank_howto:
1. Lie on your side and prop yourself up on your forearm, elbow under shoulder.
2. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Hold the position without letting your hips drop.
Exercises.hollow_body_hold_desc: Advanced gymnastics exercise for deep abdominal strength.
Exercises.hollow_body_hold_howto:
1. Lying on your back, press your lower back firmly into the floor.
2. Simultaneously lift your shoulders and straight legs off the ground.
3. Maintain the position feeling your abs extremely engaged.
Exercises.crunch_desc: Classic isolation for the upper part of the rectus abdominis.
Exercises.crunch_howto:
1. Lying with knees bent, place hands behind your head without pulling your neck.
2. Lift only your shoulders off the floor, squeezing your abs.
3. Lower slowly while maintaining muscle tension.
Exercises.leg_raise_desc: Excellent exercise for the lower abdominals.
Exercises.leg_raise_howto:
1. Lying on your back, keep your legs straight.
2. Raise your legs to 90 degrees without lifting your lower back off the floor.
3. Lower them slowly, controlling the movement with your abs.
Exercises.hanging_knee_raise_desc: Targets lower abs with higher intensity.
Exercises.hanging_knee_raise_howto:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with arms straight.
2. Bring your knees toward your chest without swinging your body.
3. Lower your legs in a slow and controlled manner.
Exercises.v_ups_desc: Explosive movement that works the entire abdominal wall.
Exercises.v_ups_howto:
1. Lying on your back, reach your arms over your head.
2. Lift your torso and legs simultaneously to touch your feet.
3. Form a 'V' shape with your body and return slowly.
Exercises.bicycle_crunch_desc: Combines flexion and rotation to hit both abs and obliques.
Exercises.bicycle_crunch_howto:
1. While lying, bring the opposite elbow toward the rising knee.
2. Extend the other leg close to the floor.
3. Alternate sides in a fluid and constant motion.
Exercises.russian_twist_desc: Focuses on torso rotation and strengthening the obliques.
Exercises.russian_twist_howto:
1. Sitting down, lean your torso back and lift your feet off the floor.
2. Rotate your torso from side to side, touching your hands to the ground.
3. Keep your abs contracted to stabilize the movement.
Exercises.pallof_press_desc: Teaches the core to resist rotational forces, protecting the spine.
Exercises.pallof_press_howto:
1. Hold the cable or band at chest height from the side.
2. Extend your arms forward without letting the pulley pull your body.
3. Hold the position for a few seconds and return to the chest.
Exercises.cable_woodchop_desc: Rotational power movement for obliques and functional core.
Exercises.cable_woodchop_howto:
1. Hold the high pulley with both hands.
2. Pull the cable diagonally down and to the opposite side.
3. Rotate your torso and use abdominal strength, not just your arms.
Exercises.ab_wheel_rollout_desc: One of the most challenging exercises for spinal anti-extension.
Exercises.ab_wheel_rollout_howto:
1. Kneeling, hold the ab wheel in front of your body.
2. Roll forward as far as possible without arching your lower back.
3. Pull back using your abdominal strength.
Exercises.dead_bug_desc: Great for coordination and deep core strengthening.
Exercises.dead_bug_howto:
1. Lying on your back, arms to the ceiling and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Simultaneously lower the right arm and left leg.
3. Keep your lower back glued to the floor at all times.
Exercises.bird_dog_desc: Strengthens the posterior chain and spinal stabilizers.
Exercises.bird_dog_howto:
1. On all fours, extend the opposite arm and leg simultaneously.
2. Keep your body parallel to the floor without rotating your hips.
3. Switch sides in a slow and controlled manner.
Exercises.mountain_climbers_desc: Dynamic exercise combining core work and cardio conditioning.
Exercises.mountain_climbers_howto:
1. In a push-up position, drive one knee toward your chest.
2. Switch legs quickly, as if running on the floor.
3. Keep your back straight and hips low.
Exercises.cable_crunch_desc: Allows for adding weight for abdominal hypertrophy.
Exercises.cable_crunch_howto:
1. Kneeling in front of the pulley, hold the rope by your head.
2. Flex your torso downward, aiming to bring elbows to knees.
3. Do not use your hips to pull; focus solely on abdominal contraction.
Exercises.machine_torso_rotation_desc: Mechanical isolation for the oblique muscles.
Exercises.machine_torso_rotation_howto:
1. Sit in the machine and adjust the chest pad.
2. Rotate your torso to the side in a controlled manner.
3. Avoid using your arms to turn; the force should come from your waist.
Exercises.superman_desc: Strengthens the erector spinae and lower back region.
Exercises.superman_howto:
1. Lying face down, extend your arms and legs.
2. Lift your chest and thighs off the floor simultaneously.
3. Hold for a second at the top and lower slowly.
Exercises.back_extension_machine_desc: Safe and isolated strengthening of the paraspinal muscles.
Exercises.back_extension_machine_howto:
1. Sit or position yourself in the machine's support.
2. Push the pad backward by extending your spine.
3. Return to the starting position while maintaining weight control.
Exercises.toes_to_bar_howto:
1. Hanging from a pull-up bar, lift your straight legs.
2. Touch your toes to the bar between your hands.
3. Control the descent to avoid excessive body swinging.
Exercises.treadmill_running_desc: Excellent for calorie burning and improving cardiovascular endurance.
Exercises.treadmill_running_howto:
1. Start with a light jog to warm up.
2. Keep your torso upright and arms relaxed at a 90-degree angle.
3. Increase speed according to your fitness level.
Exercises.treadmill_walking_desc: Low-impact exercise ideal for beginners or active recovery.
Exercises.treadmill_walking_howto:
1. Adjust the speed to a firm and steady pace.
2. Use the treadmill's incline to increase the challenge without running.
3. Maintain rhythmic and deep breathing.
Exercises.elliptical_trainer_desc: Full-body cardio with near-zero impact on joints.
Exercises.elliptical_trainer_howto:
1. Place your feet on the pedals and grip the moving handles.
2. Move arms and legs in a synchronized manner.
3. Keep your spine aligned and avoid shifting all weight to your heels.
Exercises.stationary_bike_desc: Focuses on lower limbs with excellent intensity control.
Exercises.stationary_bike_howto:
1. Adjust the seat to hip height.
2. Pedal fluidly, keeping your core engaged.
3. Alternate between light resistance for speed and heavy resistance for strength.
Exercises.stair_climber_desc: Intense for legs, glutes, and the cardiovascular system.
Exercises.stair_climber_howto:
1. Maintain an upright posture, avoiding leaning heavily on the handrails.
2. Place your entire foot on the step for greater glute activation.
3. Keep a steady pace that raises your heart rate.
Exercises.rowing_machine_desc: Works about 85% of the body's muscles in a single motion.
Exercises.rowing_machine_howto:
1. Push with your legs first, then lean back slightly and pull with your arms.
2. Return your arms, lean forward, then bend your legs.
3. Keep the movement fluid and your back protected.
Exercises.assault_bike_desc: The ultimate tool for high-power HIIT workouts.
Exercises.assault_bike_howto:
1. Use leg and arm power simultaneously.
2. Resistance increases as you apply more speed.
3. Perform short bursts of maximum effort followed by rest.
Exercises.jumping_jacks_desc: Classic warm-up exercise and motor coordination builder.
Exercises.jumping_jacks_howto:
1. Start standing with arms at your sides.
2. Jump while spreading your legs and bringing hands above your head.
3. Return to the starting position with another jump.
Exercises.burpees_desc: Full-body movement that demands strength, agility, and stamina.
Exercises.burpees_howto:
1. Squat, place hands on the floor, and jump back to a plank position.
2. Touch your chest to the floor, return to a squat.
3. Jump up while clapping your hands above your head.
Exercises.jump_rope_desc: Very high calorie burn focusing on agility and calves.
Exercises.jump_rope_howto:
1. Rotate the rope using only your wrists, not your arms.
2. Jump low, just enough for the rope to pass under your feet.
3. Keep knees slightly bent to absorb impact.
Exercises.high_knees_desc: Quickly raises heart rate and works on running mechanics.
Exercises.high_knees_howto:
1. Run in place, lifting your knees to hip height.
2. Use your arms to pace the movement.
3. Land on the balls of your feet quickly.
Exercises.box_jumps_desc: Develops explosive power and anaerobic capacity.
Exercises.box_jumps_howto:
1. Stand in front of a stable box.
2. Jump with both feet, landing softly and quietly.
3. Stand up completely before stepping down carefully.
Exercises.outdoor_running_desc: Dynamic variation with different terrains and air resistance.
Exercises.outdoor_running_howto:
1. Choose appropriate footwear for the ground surface.
2. Stay mindful of posture and hydration.
3. Use the environment (hills) to vary intensity.
Exercises.swimming_desc: Therapeutic full-body cardio without joint impact.
Exercises.swimming_howto:
1. Keep your body horizontal in the water.
2. Focus on stroke technique and lateral breathing.
3. Alternate between styles (Crawl, Backstroke, Breaststroke) for variety.
Exercises.cycling_outdoor_desc: Great for long durations and leg muscle endurance.
Exercises.cycling_outdoor_howto:
1. Check safety equipment before starting.
2. Maintain a constant pedaling cadence.
3. Use the bike's gears to manage effort on inclines.
Exercises.battle_ropes_desc: Intense metabolic workout challenging arm strength and core.
Exercises.battle_ropes_howto:
1. Hold the rope ends with knees slightly bent.
2. Create alternating or simultaneous waves with rapid arm movements.
3. Keep your core tight to prevent excessive body swaying.
Exercises.neck_lateral_stretch_desc: Relieves tension in the trapezius and lateral cervical muscles.
Exercises.neck_lateral_stretch_howto:
1. Gently tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear toward your shoulder.
2. Use your hand to apply minimal pressure if desired.
3. Keep your shoulders relaxed and down.
Exercises.neck_forward_flexion_desc: Stretch for the back of the neck and base of the skull.
Exercises.neck_forward_flexion_howto:
1. Slowly bring your chin toward your chest.
2. Let the weight of your head perform the stretch.
3. Breathe deeply while feeling the tension dissipate.
Exercises.cross_body_shoulder_stretch_desc: Simple stretch for the posterior deltoid.
Exercises.cross_body_shoulder_stretch_howto:
1. Cross one arm across your chest.
2. Use your other arm to gently press the elbow against your body.
3. Keep the stretched shoulder down, away from your ear.
Exercises.doorway_chest_stretch_desc: Opens the ribcage and corrects rounded shoulder posture.
Exercises.doorway_chest_stretch_howto:
1. Place your forearm on a door frame with the elbow at shoulder height.
2. Take a small step forward until you feel your chest stretch.
3. Keep your gaze forward and do not tilt your torso.
Exercises.overhead_triceps_stretch_desc: Stretches the back of the arm and the shoulder joint.
Exercises.overhead_triceps_stretch_howto:
1. Raise one arm and bend the elbow, reaching your hand down your back.
2. With the other hand, gently push the elbow downward.
3. Keep your head up and your torso straight.
Exercises.childs_pose_desc: A relaxing stretch for the entire spine and lower back.
Exercises.childs_pose_howto:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels.
2. Lean forward until your forehead touches the floor, stretching your arms out.
3. Breathe deeply and relax your body weight over your thighs.
Exercises.cat_cow_stretch_desc: Improves fluidity and mobility between the vertebrae.
Exercises.cat_cow_stretch_howto:
1. On all fours, arch your back up like a cat, looking at your navel.
2. Then, drop your belly and look up, tilting your tailbone up.
3. Alternate between the two movements smoothly.
Exercises.cobra_stretch_desc: Stretches the rectus abdominis and improves spinal extension.
Exercises.cobra_stretch_howto:
1. Lie face down and place your hands under your shoulders.
2. Push off the floor, straightening your arms and lifting your chest.
3. Keep your shoulders away from your ears and look forward.
Exercises.lying_spinal_twist_desc: Relieves lower back tension and improves torso rotation.
Exercises.lying_spinal_twist_howto:
1. Lying on your back, bring one knee to your chest and cross it over your body.
2. Try to keep both shoulders on the floor and look in the opposite direction.
3. Use your hand to gently guide the knee toward the ground.
Exercises.pigeon_pose_desc: Deep stretch for glutes and hip openers.
Exercises.pigeon_pose_howto:
1. Bring one knee forward, placing the shin on the floor in front of you.
2. Extend the other leg completely straight behind you.
3. If possible, lean your torso over the front leg to intensify.
Exercises.kneeling_hip_flexor_stretch_desc: Essential for those who spend a lot of time sitting.
Exercises.kneeling_hip_flexor_stretch_howto:
1. In a lunge position with one knee on the floor, push your hips forward.
2. Keep your torso upright and squeeze the glute of the back leg.
3. Feel the stretch in the front of the thigh and groin.
Exercises.butterfly_stretch_desc: Focuses on the adductors and opening the pelvis.
Exercises.butterfly_stretch_howto:
1. Seated, bring the soles of your feet together and let knees drop out.
2. Hold your feet and gently lean your torso forward.
3. Use your elbows to lightly press your thighs downward.
Exercises.standing_quadriceps_stretch_desc: Classic stretch for the front of the thigh.
Exercises.standing_quadriceps_stretch_howto:
1. Standing, bend one knee and hold your foot behind your body.
2. Keep your knees aligned and push your hips forward.
3. Use a wall for balance if necessary.
Exercises.seated_hamstring_stretch_desc: Relieves stiffness in the back of the legs.
Exercises.seated_hamstring_stretch_howto:
1. Seated with one leg extended, lean your torso toward your foot.
2. Try to keep the leg straight and your back as flat as possible.
3. Feel the stretch behind the thigh and knee.
Exercises.standing_calf_stretch_desc: Stretches the gastrocnemius and Achilles tendon.
Exercises.standing_calf_stretch_howto:
1. Place hands on a wall and step back with one leg.
2. Keep the back heel on the floor and the leg straight.
3. Lean forward until you feel your calf muscle stretch.
Exercises.worlds_greatest_stretch_desc: A dynamic movement that mobilizes almost every joint.
Exercises.worlds_greatest_stretch_howto:
1. In a lunge position, place the opposite hand on the floor.
2. Rotate your torso and reach the other arm toward the ceiling.
3. Keep the back leg straight and core engaged.
Exercises.wrist_extensor_stretch_desc: Prevents repetitive strain injuries in the forearms.
Exercises.wrist_extensor_stretch_howto:
1. Extend one arm forward with the palm facing down.
2. Use the other hand to pull your fingers toward the ground.
3. Keep your elbow straight during the movement.
Exercises.barbell_clean_and_press_desc: A classic strength movement that takes the weight from the floor to overhead.
Exercises.barbell_clean_and_press_howto:
1. Pull the bar from the floor with an explosive move to your shoulders (Clean).
2. Stabilize your body and press the bar overhead (Press).
3. Keep your core tight to protect your lower back throughout the movement.
Exercises.barbell_snatch_desc: The most complex Olympic weightlifting lift, requiring speed and precision.
Exercises.barbell_snatch_howto:
1. With a wide grip, pull the bar from the floor explosively.
2. In a single motion, catch the bar overhead while dropping into a squat.
3. Stand up completely with the bar stabilized.
Exercises.barbell_thruster_desc: A fluid combination of a front squat and an overhead press.
Exercises.barbell_thruster_howto:
1. With the bar on your shoulders, perform a deep front squat.
2. As you rise, use the leg drive to push the bar overhead.
3. The movement should be continuous and rhythmic.
Exercises.dumbbell_man_makers_desc: An intense sequence mixing push-ups, rows, squats, and overhead presses.
Exercises.dumbbell_man_makers_howto:
1. In a plank position holding dumbbells, perform a push-up and a row with each arm.
2. Jump into a squat position and stand up with dumbbells on your shoulders.
3. Finish by pressing the dumbbells overhead.
Exercises.dumbbell_snatch_unilateral_desc: An accessible snatch version that builds explosion and coordination.
Exercises.dumbbell_snatch_unilateral_howto:
1. With the dumbbell on the floor between your feet, pull it up rapidly.
2. Keep the weight close to your body and extend your arm overhead in one motion.
3. Alternate arms for each repetition.
Exercises.turkish_get_up_desc: The ultimate test of stability, mobility, and total body strength.
Exercises.turkish_get_up_howto:
1. Start lying down with one arm extended holding the weight.
2. Follow the steps to sit up, kneel, and finally stand up, never bending the arm.
3. Reverse the process until you are lying down again.
Exercises.bear_crawl_desc: Locomotion movement that challenges the core, shoulders, and coordination.
Exercises.bear_crawl_howto:
1. On all fours (hands and feet), keep your hips low and your back flat.
2. Walk forward by moving the opposite arm and foot simultaneously.
3. Keep your knees close to the ground without touching it.
Exercises.medicine_ball_slam_desc: Develops explosive power and abdominal strength.
Exercises.medicine_ball_slam_howto:
1. Raise the ball overhead with arms extended.
2. Throw the ball against the floor with maximum force, using your entire body.
3. Squat to pick up the ball and repeat.
Exercises.tire_flip_desc: Functional brute strength exercise recruiting legs, back, and arms.
Exercises.tire_flip_howto:
1. Squat deep and place your hands under the tire.
2. Explode upward using your legs and push the tire over.
3. Keep your chest against the tire and your spine neutral.
